title: EPISTOLA Barth Healey
html:
EPISTOLA Barth Healey

Helen W. Power, in “Women on Language; Women in Language,” [XV,2] may bewail the insensitivity of the male. But she betrays her own elitist insensitivity when she describes a flight attendant as “the person who passes peanuts on an airplane.” I hope Ms./Miss/Mrs. Power never needs to draw on the considerable first-aid and emergency training that every attendant must master.

[Barth Healey, Pt. Washington, New York]
